item.title: Pk Point Exchange Problem
item.dc:creator: @zlatan24 zlatan24
item.description:
@zlatan24 wrote:

[quote=“Sp3ke, post:1, topic:296348”]I’ve got a fully working PVP Point exchange system but the problem is when I value an item it gives me both the PVP Points price AND the coin price.

An example : -

“Dragon boots costs 30 pk points”
“Dragon boots costs 30 coins”

I don’t want it giving me the price in coins aswell, any ideas?

There’s nothing wrong with the code either : -

		[code]		if (MyShopID == 1) {
        sM(getItemName(removeID)+": currently costs "+ShopValue+" pkpoints"+ShopAdd);
				}[/code][/quote]

MS Exchange is quite complicated application as concerns any problems. But I think there is one good medicine which names the special tool. I paid heed to at one soft blog and after it proved all its positive properties due to it is able to resolve any problem with ms exchange for some minutes - recovery exchange server.

Read full topic

item.title: Pk Point Exchange Problem
item.dc:creator: @Epic_Ancient Epic Ancient
item.description:
@Epic_Ancient wrote:

It’s item 0995, so if you removed/changed that, you mess up quite a bit of your currency, unless you’re using a pk-point based server.

Read full topic

item.title: Pk Point Exchange Problem
item.dc:creator: @Sp3ke Sp3ke
item.description:
@Sp3ke wrote:

I think there’s gotta be a way to remove it, I was thinking maybe it’s something in item.cfg as it’s getting the value of the item.

Read full topic

item.title: Pk Point Exchange Problem
item.dc:creator: @Epic_Ancient Epic Ancient
item.description:
@Epic_Ancient wrote:

Doesn’t seem like you can remove it.

I’ve seen an easier way of using PK Points than using a shop:

Make a command for ::pkitems or something, to bring up a quest page telling you what items you can buy with pk points, and how much it is.

Then make commands ::blackmask/::itemname to buy the items, and make sure it takes away and recognizes change in pk points.

Read full topic
